newsitem.title: USA: Inference adopts shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Inference adopts shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Inference Corp said its board of directors adopted a shareholder rights plan, intended to guard against potential unsolicited takeover attempts.
The company said the plan is not in response to any specific proposal to acquire Inference.

Under the plan, stockholders will receive one right to purchase one one-hundredth of a share of a new series of preferred stock for each outstanding share of Inference common stock held at December 10, 1996.
The rights distribution will not be taxable to stockholders.

The rights, which will initially trade with the common Stock, become exercisable to purchase one one-hundredth of a share of the new preferred stock, at $40.00 per right, when someone acquires 20 percent or more of Inference's common stock or announces a tender offer that could result in such person owning 20 percent or more of the common.
Inference provides software for strategic knowledge publishing, knowledge distribution and content management.
